message.entry: Lower and upper bounds must have the same data type.
Lower and upper bounds must have compatible sizes with the input array or the corresponding variables in the input table.
The size of the lower bound must be compatible with the size of the upper bound.
Lower bound must be less than or equal to upper bound.
Tabular bounds are only supported when the first input is tabular.
Lower and upper bounds must be nonmissing.
When arguments have mixed numeric data types, bounds must be within the range of values that the type of the input data can represent.
Name-value arguments ''DataVariables'' and ''ReplaceValues'' are supported only for tabular input data.
Incorrect number of input arguments. Each parameter name must be followed by a corresponding value.
Input data, lower bound, and upper bound must be real.
Lower and upper bounds must be one-row tables if the table variables to operate on have mixed data types.
''DataVariables'' value must be a variable name, a vector of variable names, variable indices, logical values, a pattern, a function handle, or a vartype subscript.
''DataVariables'' function handle must return a logical scalar.
Variable names specified by ''DataVariables'' must match variable names in tabular bounds.
Variable names in tabular lower and upper bounds must match.
Variable names in tabular lower and upper bounds must be present in the input table.
Table variables in upper bound must have the same size as table variables in lower bound.
